purpose.summary: This PSB source file defines the Program Specification Block for the COBOL program PAUTBUNL, specifying IMS database access via a single PCB named PAUTBPCB to the DBPAUTP0 database with PROCOPT=GOTP and KEYLEN=14. It declares two sensed segments: PAUTSUM0 as the root segment (PARENT=0) and PAUTDTL1 as a child segment under PAUTSUM0. The PSB is generated for COBOL language compatibility without compatibility mode.

inputs.name: PAUTSUM0
inputs.description: Root segment (PARENT=0) of the DBPAUTP0 IMS database, accessible via PAUTBPCB PCB

inputs.name: PAUTDTL1
inputs.description: Child segment (PARENT=PAUTSUM0) of the DBPAUTP0 IMS database, accessible via PAUTBPCB PCB

business_rules.description: PCB access constrained to processing options defined by PROCOPT=GOTP, permitting Get Unique retrieval operations with positioning support
business_rules.logic_summary: PROCOPT=GOTP in PCB definition limits DL/I calls to compatible retrieval verbs (G for Get Unique, P for Positioned, O/T for additional IMS-specific options)

business_rules.description: Key length for DL/I segment searches limited to 14 bytes
business_rules.logic_summary: KEYLEN=14 specifies the length of the concatenated key for unqualified segment access in Get Unique calls

open_questions.question: What is the business purpose of the DBPAUTP0 database and PAUT segments?
open_questions.context: PSB defines access structure but provides no descriptive comments on data content or application use
open_questions.suggestion: Examine the associated DBD source for DBPAUTP0 or the COBOL program PAUTBUNL source code
